channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Urgent Action Needed on Waste Accumulation and Rodent Infestation, 12th August
item.description:
In March, a report was submitted about the growing waste issue on Mandela Way opposite to Tesco petrol station. Unfortunately, the problem has not been addressed and has worsened over time. The waste continues to accumulate, creating an unsightly and unsanitary environment. More concerning, the area is now attracting rats, which poses a significant public health risk. Immediate action is needed to clean up the waste and tackle the rodent problem. This situation requires urgent attention to protect the health and safety of the community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mandela Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bermondsey Bar And Kitchen Bin Waste has made the pavement/street a health hazard, 12th August
item.description:
Bermondsey Bar and Kitchen roll their bins onto the pavement and road. Both the road and pavement are now thick with black, sticky waste which is a health hazard. People cross over the road to avoid it now. Please insist they clean their mess up or pay a firm to do so. Jet washing for example.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Snowsfields, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of wood on corner of Beaconsfield Road and Holly Park Road. N11, 12th August
item.description:
Someone has left a lot of wood (a broken up cabinet) on the pavement, at the corner of Holly Park and Beaconsfield Roads. It takes up most of the pavement and it's a really bad trip hazard, especially at night when people won't see it. It's just after you turn the corner, so will come as a surprise as people turn into the road. I'm worried especially about elderly people who walk past, but it's a danger for everyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Beaconsfield Road, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
